title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.11 - Police officer procedure for uniform traffic ticket
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.11 - Police officer procedure for uniform traffic ticket

State Regulations
(a) When an alleged traffic violator is
issued a uniform traffic ticket, the police officer shall sign or print his
name on part I of the packet and deliver same to the alleged violator, shall
swear to part II before a person authorized to administer the necessary oath or
affirm the complaint under penalty of perjury, and shall deliver parts II, III
and IV to the court in which the alleged violator is notified to appear. He
shall retain part V for his own records, or deliver it to the enforcement
agency depending upon the procedure adopted by the enforcement
agency. (b) If a ticket, or packet, is mutilated or voided, the police officer to whom it has been assigned shall
return all parts of the packet thereof to the enforcement agency which assigned
the same to him. (c) If a ticket, or packet, is lost, the police officer who lost the same shall file with the
enforcement agency a report, in duplicate, as to the loss of such ticket, or
packet, together with any remaining parts of the packet in the event only part
of the packet has been lost. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
